Understands and accepts the situation with Aileen, showing emotional awareness.
Offers a straightforward response when Aileen asks if he wants her to go home with him, showing clear communication.
Carries Aileen's bag while walking to the car, demonstrating helpfulness but not necessarily competence.
Admits to having some money but declines Aileen's invitation to go to Florida or college, showing some decisiveness but limited ambition or planning.
Offers Aileen money he earned and hands it to her without hesitation.
Holds Aileen's photograph without looking at it, indicating a reserved but sincere attachment.
Accepts Aileen's hug and farewell with a simple 'Okay,' showing quiet respect and sincerity.
Watches Aileen leave alone, showing a moment of silent emotional connection.
Offers money he earned to Aileen without hesitation, showing responsibility and capability.
Takes the photograph without looking at it, indicating emotional restraint and focus.
Asks the ticket agent about bus schedules and plans next steps logically.
Does not show confusion or hesitation when the agent sarcastically mentions Canada, instead clarifies his destination calmly.
Makes a collect call to his father, speaks softly and apologetically, reassures him he will be home soon.
Uses money left by Lucy to pay for his ticket without complaint or hesitation.
Shows no overt friendliness or warmth during the phone call, keeps conversation brief and factual.
Considers the travel options carefully and chooses Great Falls.
Pays for a ticket using money left by Lucy and keeps it safely.
Makes a collect call to his father to inform him of his whereabouts and plans.
Speaks softly and somewhat apologetically, showing some uncertainty and lack of confidence.
Appears abstracted and undirected while waiting for the bus, indicating mental fatigue or lack of focus.
Watches two girls, one resembling Lucy, with a sense of reminiscence and fixation.
Responds briefly and somewhat closed off to the man’s questions at the bus station.
Engages in small talk with the man at the bus station, answering questions honestly though tersely.
Throws away the bandage on his hand and wanders restlessly around the bus station, becoming abstracted and undirected.
Passively overhears conversations and fixates on random details, showing distraction and lack of focus.
Plays pinball and watches the fry-cook, showing attempts to occupy himself but no purposeful action.
Remembers Lucy and stands transfixed, lost in thought rather than engaging with his surroundings.
Responds briefly and somewhat evasively to the man’s questions, showing minimal engagement but no clear demonstration of skill or confidence.
Responds to suspicion with a sarcastic but not hostile remark ('Looks lie, then').
Refuses to share personal information about his parents ('None of your business').
Accepts a potential job offer earnestly despite uncertainty and lack of experience ('I’ll take a job if you got one. I can work.').
Responds suspiciously and uninterestedly to questions about his financial status and work prospects.
Admits earnestly that he does not know anything about roughneck work but is willing to learn and take a job if offered.
Avoids sharing personal information and deflects questions about his family and hand injury.
Looks around the bus station, contemplates his prospects, and then decides to accept a job opportunity despite uncertainty.
Smiles and shows some playful suspicion but follows the man into the restroom despite misgivings.
Does not resist or retaliate when unexpectedly attacked by the man, scrambles up and gasps for breath.
Smiles suspiciously, hesitates but follows the man into the restroom despite misgivings.
Looks around the room, waits uncertainly, not sure what to expect.
Is caught off guard and physically overpowered by the man, scrambles up gasping for breath.
Fights back fiercely and unmercifully when attacked, showing self-defense and determination.
Refuses to help the man out of the bathroom stall after the fight.
Engages in a tense negotiation over a job, standing firm but without hostility.
Slides off the man's attack and hits him multiple times in the face using his injured hand, knocking the man off balance and causing him to fall.
Stops fighting abruptly and steps back after the man surrenders, showing control over the situation.
Negotiates confidently and successfully for a higher wage despite initial rejection.
Feels confused and belligerent after the fight, eyes darting, indicating some internal turmoil or lack of emotional control.
Lies about being broke to the man.
Politely shakes hands and introduces himself to Billy Abbott.
Makes a place for himself quietly and settles in the back of the pickup without complaint.
Responds softly and honestly when corrected about being a farm boy.
Negotiates the price up from six hundred to eight hundred dollars confidently and silently holds his ground when challenged.
Lies about being broke to get money from the man, showing quick thinking and resourcefulness.
Accepts the man’s help and rides in the back of the pickup without protest, showing adaptability and composure.

Remains silent and contemplative while the truck idles at the red light, showing patience and calm observation.
